question: Describe the role of the CPU in the computer.
answer:
• Controls all the other parts of the computer
• Executes programs / instructions
• Fetches, decodes and executes instructions
• Carries out processing / arithmetic and logic operations
(Max 2 marks)

question: Describe the role of the microprocessor in the system and how it checks whether the parking cost has been paid.
answer:
• Microprocessor checks if sensor is activated (1)
• Microprocessor compares time the car has been parked against time paid (1)
• If time parked > time paid, then trigger signal to output (e.g. barrier/alert) (1)
(Max 3 marks)

question: State the name of the CPU component that sends signals to manage the fetch-decode-execute cycle.
Describe the role of the MDR in the fetch-decode-execute cycle.
answer:
• Stores data that has just been fetched from memory (1)
• Holds data that is to be sent to memory (1)

question: Identify three other registers in the CPU.
answer:
Any three from:
• Program Counter (PC)
• Memory Address Register (MAR)
• Current Instruction Register (CIR)
• Accumulator (ACC)

question:
(i) State the purpose of a register.
(ii) Give three CPU registers.
(iii) Describe the purpose of the ALU.
answer:
(i) Temporary data store / stores data or instruction being processed
(ii) Any three from: MAR, MDR, CIR, PC, ACC
(iii) Performs arithmetic and logic operations

question: Describe the role of the MAR.
answer: • Stores the address of the location in memory where data or an instruction is to be fetched or stored

question: Explain why a different CPU can increase performance.
answer:
• Higher clock speed – more instructions per second
• More cores – multiple instructions processed simultaneously
• Larger cache – more data stored closer to CPU
(Any two for max 2)

question: Explain the purpose of cache in the CPU.
answer:
• Stores frequently used instructions or data
• Reduces time needed to access memory
• Speeds up processing

question: Explain the effect of increasing clock speed from 2.4 GHz to 3.5 GHz on CPU performance.
answer:
• Higher clock speed allows more instructions per second to be executed
• Speeds up processing
• Increases overall performance

question: State the name of the list of machine code commands processed by the CPU.
Define the term instruction set.
answer:
• The complete set of instructions understood/executed by a CPU
• Written in machine code / binary
• Instructions used in programs
(Max 2 marks)

question: Give two characteristics of an embedded system.
answer:
• Dedicated to one task
• Built into the device
• Cannot be easily reprogrammed

question: Circle three examples of an embedded system.
answer:
Correct answers:
• Microwave
• Washing machine
• Traffic lights
(Award 1 mark for all 3 circled correctly)

question: State what is meant by an embedded system.
answer:
• A computer system that performs a dedicated function
• Built into a larger device/system

question: Explain why a smartwatch is not a general-purpose computer.
answer:
• Designed for specific functions
• Limited capability compared to PCs
• Cannot run a wide range of software
